[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Struct: HandshakeMsg] [Display/Debug leakage] Do the Display and Debug implementations leak sensitive information about network topology or validator configuration? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Struct: HandshakeMsg] [Clone safety] Can cloning HandshakeMsg with shared BitVec references cause use-after-free or double-free vulnerabilities? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Enum: ProtocolId] [Enum exhaustiveness] Can adding new ProtocolId variants break existing match statements that don't use wildcards, causing panics or undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Enum: ProtocolId] [Repr(u8) overflow] Can ProtocolId values exceed 255, violating the repr(u8) constraint and causing truncation or corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Function: all()] [Stale protocol list] Can the all() function become outdated when new protocols are added, causing incomplete protocol negotiation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Enum: ProtocolId] [Unused protocols] DiscoveryDirectSend and MempoolRpc are marked unused - can attackers exploit these to bypass active protocol validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Enum: ProtocolId] [Serialization stability] Can changes to ProtocolId enum ordering break backward compatibility with older nodes still using old protocol numbers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Function: as_str()] [String injection] Can the string representations returned by as_str() be exploited for log injection or command injection attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Enum: MessagingProtocolVersion] [Single version limitation] Only V1 exists - can this lack of version diversity be exploited if vulnerabilities are found in V1? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Enum: MessagingProtocolVersion] [Ordering dependency] Does PartialOrd derivation correctly handle future version additions, or can version comparison be exploited? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Enum: MessagingProtocolVersion] [Version downgrade] Can attackers force all nodes to use V1 even after newer versions are deployed, preventing security upgrades? (High)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Enum: HandshakeError] [Error information leakage] Do HandshakeError messages leak sensitive information about expected chain_id or network_id values to attackers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Enum: HandshakeError] [Error handling bypass] Can attackers exploit differences in how InvalidChainId, InvalidNetworkId, and NoCommonProtocols errors are handled? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Function: perform_handshake()] [Error recovery] Are handshake errors properly logged and monitored, or can attackers perform silent reconnaissance by triggering different error conditions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Anyhow error wrapping] Can the anyhow error type be exploited to cause panic propagation or error recovery failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Function: perform_handshake()] [Concurrent handshakes] Can multiple simultaneous handshakes from the same peer cause race conditions in protocol negotiation or connection state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Serialization race] If to_bytes() is called concurrently for the same message from multiple threads, can this cause data races or corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Function: from_bytes()] [Deserialization race] Can concurrent from_bytes() calls on shared message buffers cause data races or use-after-free? (High)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Function: from_bytes()] [Decompression memory] Can decompression allocate unbounded temporary buffers before size checks, causing memory exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Function: perform_handshake()] [BTreeMap iteration] Can extremely large BTreeMaps in supported_protocols cause CPU exhaustion during iteration? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/network/framework/src/protocols/wire/handshake/v1/mod.rs] [Function: iter()] [Iterator DoS] Can malicious BitVec with sparse bits cause iter() to perform excessive iterations, exhausting CPU? (Medium)
